title: 113_s2028
content: The Act may be cited as the "Sport Fish Restoration and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2014". It includes a division of annual appropriations. Section 4 of the Federal Aid in Fish Restoration Act (16 U.S.C. 777c) is amended to update various subsections and funding allocations. Section 4 of the Federal Aid in Fish Restoration Act is amended to update subsections and funding allocations, including a set-aside for boating safety through 2021. This includes transferring funds for specific purposes outlined in title 46, United States Code, and funding the National Boating Safety Advisory Council. The Council established under section 13110 of title 46, United States Code, is allocated not less than $7,000,000 for national boating safety activities of national nonprofit public service organizations. This funding remains available until expended and is subject to a limitation on inclusion in the annual appropriation distributed under subsection (a). The funding allocated for national boating safety activities by the Council under section 13110 of title 46, United States Code, remains available until expended and is subject to a limitation on inclusion in the annual appropriation distributed under subsection (a). Amendments are made to subsection (b)(2) and (d) regarding the availability and use of allocated funds. Amendments are made to subsection (e) regarding the maximum amount the Secretary of the Interior may use for national boating safety activities. The annual adjusted maximum amount for fiscal year 2016 and beyond is determined based on specific criteria. The annual adjusted maximum amount for national boating safety activities for each fiscal year is calculated by adding the available maximum amount from the previous year and multiplying it by the change in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers. Extension of exception to limitation on transfers to fund from 2014 to 2021. Amendment to recreational boating safety allocations by striking subsection (c) in title 46, United States Code. Section 13107(c) of title 46, United States Code is amended to allocate funds for the Coast Guard's recreational boating safety program, with specific amounts designated for personnel expenses and compliance with chapter 43 of the title. The amendment allocates funds for the National Boating Safety Advisory Council and national boating safety activities of nonprofit organizations. The amendment updates Section 13110(e) of title 46, United States Code, changing the year from "2020" to "2021" for the National Boating Safety Advisory Council.
